titleStmt.title: Rouse his case truly stated and written with his own hand in Newgate, two days before his execution, to prevent any false reports : wherein he gives the world an account of the place and manner how he was taken ... of his defence for himself, how he was brought in guilty, sentence past : with a declaration against things charged upon him, and a confession of his faith, with his prayer for the church of God &c. : to which is annexed a letter to his wife from Newgate.
titleStmt.author: Rouse, John, d. 1683.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J. Grantham by the order of the Widdow Rouse,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.

person.persName: the order of the Widdow Rouse
